title: Rolling - heights of 2 cylinders rolling up ramps

content.question: Two uniform, solid cylinders, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, each roll without slipping along a horizontal surface with the same initial translational velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to the right, as shown in the figure. They each then roll without slipping up a ramp and rise to a maximum height <math alttext="h sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> for Cylinder <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="h sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> for Cylinder <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. Cylinder <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has four times the mass and twice the radius of Cylinder <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and the rotational inertia about the center of a uniform, solid cylinder of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is <math alttext="I equals one half m r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction h sub A over h sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mfrac></math> of the heights reached by the cylinders?
